title: Scientists find strongest evidence yet of life on an alien planet
Trump’s Press Secretary’s Dress Stirs Up Social Media in China
US judge says Trump administration could be in contempt over deportation flights
description: The US government is accused of "wilful disregard" of a ruling blocking the deportation of 200 individuals to El Salvador.

title: Telescope finds promising hints of life on distant planet
description: Scientists find new but tentative evidence that a faraway world orbiting another star may be home to life.

title: Trade war fallout: Cancellations of Chinese freight ships begin as bookings plummet
description: Canceled freight vessel sailings from China are up and will ripple through the supply chain as the trade war impact on the global economy intensifies.

title: Japan exports growth misses expectations, rising by a modest 3.9% in March as tariffs bite
description: The growth missed expectations of a 4.5% rise from economists polled by Reuters, and was lower than the 11.4% jump in February.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Israel Says One-Third Of Gaza Now Under Its Military Control
description: The Israeli military has said it is expanding the "Morag Corridor," a new dividing line in the southern Gaza Strip, and has turned roughly a third of the enclave into "security zones" under full Israeli military control.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Denies Meta Bought Rivals To Conquer Them
description: Meta chief executive Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday denied in court that his company bought rival services Instagram and WhatsApp to neutralize them, as his testimony in a landmark antitrust case came to a close.

title: A U.S.-China Trade War With Students and Tourists as Potential Pawns
description: With travel warnings and revoked visas, the two superpowers locked in a bruising trade war may make students and tourists their bargaining chips.
author: Vivian Wang

title: Keith Siegel, a Former Hostage, Recounts Captivity in Gaza
description: Keith Siegel, who spent 484 days as a hostage, described the physical and psychological distress he endured, in an interview with The New York Times.
author: Nadav Gavrielov

title: Senator heads to El Salvador to find Maryland migrant deported erroneously by Trump - ABC News
description: Senator heads to El Salvador to find Maryland migrant deported erroneously by Trump  ABC NewsKilmar Ábrego García: Deported Salvadoran will never live back in US, says White House  BBCSenator Chris Van Hollen Heads to El Salvador to Check on Deported Immigrant  The New York TimesCapitol Hill goes to war over Kilmar Abrego Garcia  PoliticoDemocratic Maryland Senator Refused Meeting in El Salvador with Controversial Deportee  National Review

title: Harvard researchers say they might have to lay off workers and euthanize research animals due to funding freeze - CNN
description: Harvard researchers say they might have to lay off workers and euthanize research animals due to funding freeze  CNNCan the president revoke a university’s tax-exempt status?  CNNUS Department of Homeland Security cancels $2.7 million in grants to Harvard  The Times of IsraelUS IRS planning to rescind Harvard's tax-exempt status amid Trump feud, CNN reports  ReutersResearch Funding  Harvard University

title: Trump’s D.C. U.S. attorney pick appeared on Russian state media over 150 times
description: Trump nominee Ed Martin’s 100-plus appearances on Russian state-directed media RT and Sputnik from 2016 to 2024 alarm some former national security officials.
author: Spencer Hsu, Aaron Schaffer

title: Russian missiles hit Sumy civilians as military held ceremony, soldier says
description: A military awards ceremony was being held underground near where Russian missiles struck. The soldiers were unharmed; dozens of civilians outside were killed.
author: Siobhán O'Grady, Anastacia Galouchka

title: US pastor kidnapped during sermon in South Africa rescued after shootout
description: Joshua Sullivan was abducted from his church by four gunmen, but is now recovering and in ‘excellent condition’South African police have rescued an American pastor who was abducted last week while he was conducting a sermon, as kidnappings have soared over the last decade in the country.Three unidentified suspects were killed during the “high-intensity shootout” on Tuesday in which Joshua Sullivan, a missionary from Tennessee, was rescued, the Hawks, the police unit that deals with serious crime in South Africa, said in a statement. Continue reading...
author: Rachel Savage in Johannesburg

title: UK conference on Sudan fails to set up contact group for ceasefire talks
description: Major setback for diplomatic efforts to end two years of civil war as Arab states refuse to sign joint communiqueA British-led attempt to establish a contact group to facilitate ceasefire talks in Sudan fell apart on Tuesday when Arab states refused to sign a joint communique after a conference in London.The daylong argument between Egypt, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates over the communique represents a big diplomatic setback for efforts to end two years of civil war in Sudan. Continue reading...
author: Patrick Wintour Diplomatic editor

title: ‘These are the criminals Trump wants removed’: Mother of murder victim speaks at White House
description: Patty Morin, the mother of murdered Rachel Morin, made an emotional plea at the White House, urging for border protection following her daughter's death by an illegal immigrant. The appearance came amidst criticism over the mistaken deportation of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a Salvadoran man with protected status, highlighting immigration policy debates.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Abrupt visa termination: Indian student, 3 others sue Trump admin
description: Four international students from Michigan universities, including one from India, are suing the Department of Homeland Security. They allege their student visas were abruptly terminated without explanation, jeopardizing their studies and risking deportation. The ACLU of Michigan is representing the students, arguing the terminations were based on minor interactions with law enforcement and are deterring future international scholars.
author: TOI World Desk
